page.title: 14Churches:Chinnor etc
page.content: Since 1972 the Rector of Chinnor -Church of St Andrew-has served the united parish of Chinnor, with Sydenham and Emmington. St Mary's Church at Sydenham is 13th Century, quite large and still used regularly. St Nicholas's Church at Emmington is 12th Century and much smaller. Here services are held monthly. This church has a Norman font. There is a strong tradition of nonconformity; none of the three villages has a Catholic Church. Indeed a recent history of Sydenham tells us that no record of Roman Catholicism has been found. This village has two Baptist Chapels but neither exist now. One turned to Methodism at one time but is now a private house. Chinnor had a Baptist chapel once but no longer.
